title: Resistance
data:
**[English]()**

 • [한국어](/wiki/Resistance/ko "Resistance/ko")

In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, **resistances** are [properties](/wiki/Properties "Properties") that protect you against several harmful effects that you may encounter in the dungeon. A resistance can be either [intrinsic](/wiki/Intrinsic "Intrinsic"), meaning a natural resistance, or [extrinsic](/wiki/Extrinsic "Extrinsic"), meaning a resistance gained by [wearing](/wiki/Wear "Wear") or [wielding](/wiki/Wield "Wield") a certain item. Many intrinsic resistances can only be gained by [polymorphing](/wiki/Polymorphing "Polymorphing") into a certain creature, which is not very convenient.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Intrinsic resistances](#Intrinsic_resistances)
- [2 Extrinsic resistances](#Extrinsic_resistances)
- [3 List of resistances](#List_of_resistances)
- [4 See also](#See_also)

## Intrinsic resistances

One of the most common ways to gain intrinsic resistances is through the eating of [corpses](/wiki/Corpses "Corpses"). Of special note are [dragon](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon") corpses, as they are guaranteed to give resistances based on their color as specified below, with the exception of yellow, gray and silver. Other monsters also provide intrinsic resistances if their corpses are eaten, details of which can be found in the individual monster descriptions.

## Extrinsic resistances

Extrinsic resistance is obtained, by definition, through items. [Dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail") and the lower [dragon scales](/wiki/Dragon_scale "Dragon scale") provide reliable methods for many resistances. [Artifacts](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") also often provide resistances, some of which are hard to obtain otherwise.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Resistances conferred by worn or wielded items have a 99% chance of protecting your [inventory](/wiki/Inventory "Inventory"); see [this commit](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/9942b65df78dd55a7806ec6ea2821693a7131c97).

## List of resistances

A non-exhaustive table of the resistances and methods to obtain them is as follows:

| Resistance                                                                               | Dragon corpse | Dragon scales                                                                                     | Item                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | Polymorph form (see [Monster resistances](/wiki/Monster_resistances "Monster resistances"))                                    |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| [Acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance")                               | *None*        | Yellow                                                                                            | [Alchemy smock](/wiki/Alchemy_smock "Alchemy smock")                                                                                                                                                                      | Any acidic-corpse monster (e.g. [acid blob](/wiki/Acid_blob "Acid blob"))                                                      |
| [Cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance")                               | White         | White                                                                                             | *Many*                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | Many "cold" monsters                                                                                                           |
| [Disintegration resistance](/wiki/Disintegration_resistance "Disintegration resistance") | Black         | Black                                                                                             | None                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | (baby) black dragon                                                                                                            |
| [Fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance")                               | Red           | Red                                                                                               | *Many*                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | Many "hot" monsters                                                                                                            |
| [Magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance")                            | *None*        | Gray                                                                                              | [Cloak of magic resistance](/wiki/Cloak_of_magic_resistance "Cloak of magic resistance") Many [Quest artifacts](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact")                                                                    | (baby) gray dragon                                                                                                             |
| [Poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance")                         | Green         | Green                                                                                             | [Ring of poison resistance](/wiki/Ring_of_poison_resistance "Ring of poison resistance"), [amulet versus poison](/wiki/Amulet_versus_poison "Amulet versus poison"), [Alchemy smock](/wiki/Alchemy_smock "Alchemy smock") | Undead, demons, many "poisonous" monsters                                                                                      |
| [Shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance")                            | Blue          | Blue                                                                                              | [Ring of shock resistance](/wiki/Ring_of_shock_resistance "Ring of shock resistance")                                                                                                                                     |                                                                                                                                |
| [Sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance")                            | Orange        | Orange                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | Undead, elves                                                                                                                  |
| [Hallucination](/wiki/Hallucination "Hallucination") resistance                          | *None*        | *None*                                                                                            | [Grayswandir](/wiki/Grayswandir "Grayswandir")                                                                                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                |
| [Drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance")                            | *None*        | Deep (*[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") only*)                                             | [Excalibur](/wiki/Excalibur "Excalibur") [The Staff of Aesculapius](/wiki/The_Staff_of_Aesculapius "The Staff of Aesculapius") [Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer "Stormbringer")                                          | Any undead or demon                                                                                                            |
| [Stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning") resistance                                            | *None*        | [chromatic](/wiki/Chromatic_dragon_\(UnNetHack\) "Chromatic dragon (UnNetHack)") (UnNetHack only) |                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | Acidic or stone-based creatures (e.g. [gargoyles](/wiki/Gargoyle "Gargoyle"), [stone golems](/wiki/Stone_golem "Stone golem")) |
| [Sliming](/wiki/Sliming "Sliming") resistance                                            | *None*        | *None*                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | [Green slime](/wiki/Green_slime "Green slime"), fiery (not merely "hot") creatures                                             |
| [Sickness](/wiki/Sickness "Sickness") resistance                                         | *None*        | *None*                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | [Ghoul](/wiki/Ghoul "Ghoul"), [fungi](/wiki/Fungus "Fungus")                                                                   |

## See also

- [Monster resistances](/wiki/Monster_resistances "Monster resistances")
- [Monster resistances (UnNetHack)](/wiki/Monster_resistances_\(UnNetHack\) "Monster resistances (UnNetHack)")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Resistance

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 한국어

In NetHack, resistances are properties that protect you against several harmful effects that you may encounter in the dungeon. A resistance can be either intrinsic, meaning a natural resistance, or extrinsic, meaning a resistance gained by wearing or wielding a certain item. Many intrinsic resistances can only be gained by polymorphing into a certain creature, which is not very convenient.

Contents

  • 1 Intrinsic resistances
  • 2 Extrinsic resistances
  • 3 List of resistances
  • 4 See also

Intrinsic resistances

One of the most common ways to gain intrinsic resistances is through the eating of corpses. Of special note are dragon corpses, as they are guaranteed to give resistances based on their color as specified below, with the exception of yellow, gray and silver. Other monsters also provide intrinsic resistances if their corpses are eaten, details of which can be found in the individual monster descriptions.

Extrinsic resistances

Extrinsic resistance is obtained, by definition, through items. Dragon scale mail and the lower dragon scales provide reliable methods for many resistances. Artifacts also often provide resistances, some of which are hard to obtain otherwise.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Resistances conferred by worn or wielded items have a 99% chance of protecting your inventory; see this commit.

List of resistances

A non-exhaustive table of the resistances and methods to obtain them is as follows:

Resistance Dragon corpse Dragon scales Item Polymorph form (see Monster resistances)
Acid resistance None Yellow Alchemy smock Any acidic-corpse monster (e.g. acid blob)
Cold resistance White White Many Many "cold" monsters
Disintegration resistance Black Black None (baby) black dragon
Fire resistance Red Red Many Many "hot" monsters
Magic resistance None Gray Cloak of magic resistance
Many Quest artifacts		 (baby) gray dragon
Poison resistance Green Green Ring of poison resistance, amulet versus poison, Alchemy smock Undead, demons, many "poisonous" monsters
Shock resistance Blue Blue Ring of shock resistance  
Sleep resistance Orange Orange   Undead, elves
Hallucination resistance None None Grayswandir  
Drain resistance None Deep
(SLASH'EM only)		 Excalibur
The Staff of Aesculapius
Stormbringer		 Any undead or demon
Stoning resistance None chromatic (UnNetHack only)   Acidic or stone-based creatures (e.g. gargoyles, stone golems)
Sliming resistance None None   Green slime, fiery (not merely "hot") creatures
Sickness resistance None None   Ghoul, fungi

See also

  • Monster resistances
  • Monster resistances (UnNetHack)
